.@mits_ota cross linguistic study of baby talk words in 11 langs More cv sylls but no evidence for labial to coronal preference #icphs2015
.@mits_ota baby talk words largely redundant. Eg bunny. Feature reduplication, paucity of clusters, converge on common prosody #icphs2015
.@mits_ota Do baby-talk words reflect biomechanical constraints on speech production? #icphs2015
Payne: but at 2;6 only consonant duration is modified for low vowels, and only vowel duration for high vowels #icphs2015
Payne: children from 2;6 upwards use diff vc timing relations for fortis and lenis rhymes #icphs2015
Payne: competing demands that infants must juggle, such as duration for fortis/lenis & tense/lax vowels #icpsh2015
Payne et al tell us about VC timing acquisition: integrating phonetics and phonology #icphs2015
Redford: children produce same Ling temporal patterns as adults despite more variability in motor aspects #icphs2015
Redford: making sense of variability at one level and stability at another? Dissociation between timing at motor and ling level #icphs2015
Redford: fixed temporal patterns in child speech despite variable vowel durations #icphs2015
.@benjyraymunson implications for clinicians when modelling /s/ for children in clinic, consideration needed of social identity #icphs2015
.@benjyraymunson  /s/ tokens of diff types  presented to listeners. Rated for gender. More boy-like with frontally lisped /s/  #icphs2015
.@benjyraymunson tells us about children's production of /s/ and perceived gender. #icphs2015
.@NWhitworth1971  DS child unstable representations of auditory targets. Constant recalibration to eliminate errors. DIVA model #icphs2015
.@NWhitworth1971 diff transition frm babbling to early words in chldrn wth DS. Case study of vowels for 1 child over 32 months #icphs2015
@NWhitworth1971 talking about vowel space  in very young children with Down Syndrome #icphs2015
Tuomainen:  second mention reductions signified by duration, F0  and F2 for /i/ , and less intelligible than 1st mention #icphs2015
Tuomainen:children 9-14 yrs do diapix spot the difference task. Looking for 2nd mention of repeated items #icphs2015 http://t.co/4OFGMt2oFj
In child language session: Tuomainen et al phonetic reduction in spontaneous speech #icphs2015
RM&M: greater variability in formant freqs also observed with tiredness. Little change in suprasegmentals, but artic rate slower #icphs2015
